content.rendered:
The following services are available to all students—whether enrolled in person or online at any campus or site.  New to ULV?  Be sure to visit New to La Verne: Get Started! and view steps listed that will assist you in coordinating your military connected needs with admission and enrollment.

 

Military Connected Student Feedback Form 

Student feedback is critical for maintaining a nurturing environment for Military Connected students (i.e. Active Duty, Veterans, as well as Spouses, Dependents, and Survivors of Active Duty and Veterans) to learn and thrive.   If you have feedback, we want to hear about it!

Please share all feedback, suggestions, concerns, or support requests you may have by using the Military Connected Feedback Form  

Academic Advising and Military Academic Advising

All students are assigned an Academic Advisor and should meet with their advisor prior to each enrollment period to insure they are on track with the degree and classes. If unsure who your advisor is, you can locate your academic advisor through your La Verne DegreeTracker under QuickLinks in your La Verne Portal.  Please view this instruction video link on how to:  Find your Academic Advisor name/email on MyDegree Tracker. Once in MyDegree Tracker you can right click on the advisor’s name and select Copy Email to paste for use.

Military Advising assists VA and Active Duty Tuition Assistance (TA) students with academic advising related support.  Select advisors provide essential support to the School Certifying Officials (SCOs) with course certifications for VA benefits.  Please send only VA or TA related questions, attached forms that may need review and/or approval, as well as requests for assistance to the Advising Military email: advisingmilitary@laverne.edu.  For more information go to Military Advising | University of La Verne.

Academic Success Center (ASC) 

The Academic Success Center (ASC) is dedicated to providing all students with the tools and resources they need to become, and remain, confident, curious and engaged learners.  Learn about ASC’s services and access all of their resources here: ASC Services and Links. 

Accessibility Services

Accessibility Services supports students with documented medical, physical, psychological, attention-deficit and/or learning disabilities to help maximize their potential for success in all aspects of campus life. Services include academic accommodations, self-advocacy, skill training, and disability-related educational programming for the university community.

Career Services

The Career Center at the University of La Verne empowers students and alumni to develop a lifelong competitive and applicable skill set for an ever-changing global market through Career Readiness, a robust set of digital resources, tools, career assessments, and programming.  All students and alumni interested in participating in Career Center online programs and career counseling please utilize Handshake for all scheduling needs or contact us directly at 909-448-4052 or via email careercenter@laverne.edu. 

Regional and Online students seeking career services please contact Robert St. Juliana, Director, Career Development and Career Success Coach via email at rtsjuliana@laverne.edu, or, also utilize Handshake to schedule an appointment. 

Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS)

Students at the University of La Verne can seek counseling and psychological services to assist with anxiety and stress management, adjustment issues, mental health treatment, eating disorder or substance abuse, or any other mental or emotional health issue that may be concerning you. Students can make an appointment or call or visit for crisis support. Services are free to all students (undergraduate, graduate, adult, regional on-line campuses).

Additionally, the University of La Verne is now partnered with TimelyCare to deliver a new virtual counseling and well-being platform for students. Through either a mobile app or desktop, TimelyCare provides 24/7 access to virtual care from anywhere in the United States. TimelyCare is a complement, and does not replace, the already available support services.  It is meant to give students, especially those that are not able to come to the La Verne campus during regular business hours, more access to help and resources.

Financial Aid

The Office of Financial Aid supports all students to help insure an affordable University of La Verne education .

Student Accounts

The Office of Student Accounts is responsible for billing and collecting tuition and fees, posting payments and disbursements, processing refunds and providing general assistance to students regarding their account with the University.

Student Outreach and Support (SOS)

SOS uses a collaborative approach while working with students to navigate the challenges that stand in the way of academic and personal success.  SOS works with students individually and through group settings (workshops and trainings).  Learn more about SOS here: Student Outreach and Support
